content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was the rental price of an apartment.
name: Max Müller

content: Did you agree on a final price?
name: Evaluator

content: No, we did not agree on a final price.
name: Max Müller

content: Why did you not agree on a final price?
name: Evaluator

content: I did not agree on a final price because the landlord, Peter Schmidt, was not willing to lower the price to a level that was within my budget as a student.
name: Max Müller

content: If you did not agree on a final price, why did you continue the conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I continued the conversation in the hope that we could find a price that was acceptable to both parties. However, it became clear that Mr. Schmidt was not willing to negotiate further, so we did not reach an agreement.
name: Max Müller

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: I would rate the likeability of the negotiation partner, Peter Schmidt, as a 5.
name: Max Müller

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: No, I did not feel discriminated or offended at any point during the negotiation.
name: Max Müller
